Name: Providing certain information to users of life-sustaining equipment and individuals for whom a disruption in electrical service would create a medical emergency.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing certain information to users of life-sustaining equipment and individuals for whom a disruption in electrical service would create a medical emergency

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was noticed but did not have a Mayoral public hearing on January 8, 2018.

History.Description: This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Jan. 22, 2018 (31st Day, Jan. 19, 2018).

History.Description: This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Attachments.Name: May 25, 2016 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
December 19, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - December 19, 2017

Summary: This bill would require the New York City Department for the Aging (DFTA) to regularly provide written materials from New York Emergency Management to all senior centers and naturally occurring retirement communities sponsored by DFTA on how to register with utility companies as an individual who uses life-sustaining medical equipment or for whom a disruption in electrical service would create a medical emergency. The materials would also be posted on DFTA’s website and the website of the Mayor’s Office for People with Disabilities.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 2 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-207, to read as follows:
      �21-207 Users of life-sustaining equipment and individuals for whom a disruption in electrical service would create a medical emergency. The department shall regularly provide written materials from the office of emergency management to all senior centers in the city and all naturally occurring retirement communities sponsored by the department on how to register with any utility providing electrical service within the city as a user of life-sustaining equipment or an individual for whom a disruption in electrical service would create a medical emergency. These materials shall also be posted electronically in a conspicuous location on the department's website and on the website of the mayor's office for people with disabilities.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 30 days after it becomes law.


ENB/CCF
LS #7872
